dialog: Hi Medi, I have some questions about spirometry. What is it and how is it performed?
Spirometry is a lung function test used to diagnose and monitor respiratory diseases like asthma. It measures the amount of air you can exhale forcefully and quickly after taking a deep breath.
Can spirometry diagnose asthma in children under six years old?
Spirometry is not recommended for children under six years old
What does it mean if my spirometry result improves after taking a bronchodilator?

If the FEV1 measured by spirometry improves more than 12% and increases by at least 200 milliliters following administration of a bronchodilator such as salbutamol, this is supportive of an asthma diagnosis.
Can caffeine affect the results of a spirometry test?
Yes, caffeine is a bronchodilator in people with asthma, and its use before a lung function test may interfere with the results.

Lifestyle changes can help manage your asthma symptoms. You should avoid triggers, like tobacco smoke and air pollution, and exercise regularly.
What kind of exercise is best for people with asthma?
Low-impact exercises like walking, swimming, and biking are best for people with asthma. You should always have your rescue inhaler with you when exercising.
What should I do if I have an asthma attack while exercising?
Stop exercising immediately, take your rescue inhaler, and seek medical attention if symptoms worsen.

Foods rich in omega-3 fatty acids, like fish, nuts, and seeds, as well as fruits and vegetables, can help reduce inflammation and manage asthma symptoms.
